Program Series Proposal
Democracy has been at a disadvantage in many of the arenas of the world where
it confronts Communism in a contest for men's minds and loyalties* For democracy
is a political philosophy, fraught with responsibility and terminologies which
simple people distrust or don't understand. Cansmmism, on the other hand, has
presented itself less in political terms of human rights and individual development,
and has spoken of full stomachs, full lunch pails, full employment, and 11 sharing
the spoils of the rich oppressors.11
We have been told repeatedly by advisors from friendly nations both in Europe
and Asia that what we need is a new approach, selling the products of democracy
more than the abstract philosophy, putting our standard of living in a new frameÂ¬
work which less fortunate people do not resent. We need to cease to sell democracy
as such and begin to show how democracy works in a free capitalistic, industrial
society. How does labor fare here? How free are men? What is urban and suburban
life really like, all appliances aside? Who owns the corporations? What are the
benefits of mass production? How free and how truthful are private, industry-
controlled mass media? Does Wall Street run America?
The need for such a series has been expressed abroad and the International
University of the Mr has urged us to provide something for their over 20 native
radio networks. But it should also be of great value to America in mid-century as
we hear of Russian production of atomic devices, airplanes, engineers, scientists
and literacy. We need to understand and reevaluate our blessings, re-study our
sense of values, and encourage the maximum opportunity for dynamic development in
our social and economic life.
